intro: Plagiobothrys torreyi var. torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
